data.name: Enworden
data.detailed_description:
Enworden is a word game where you make words, as many as possible, using the tiles you're given. The game will slowly get more difficult, but you can use your cunning and intelligence to stay one step ahead. Special tiles will give you an extra edge. The objective is to get as many points as possible. How far can you get? Compete with your friends by sharing the level seed!

Make a word by clicking the tiles. The word must be an English word, and you can't play the same word twice. The first tile you click can be any of the available tiles, but the next ones can only be tiles that are connected to the already-chosen tiles, either horizontally, vertically or diagonally. When you've made a word, the tiles recharge for one turn, and after that they'll get replaced by more difficult tiles, which gradually adds to the challenge.

There is also a shop where you can use your points to buy powers. For example:

  • When you get stuck, it is advised to shuffle the board to get a fresh outlook. However, it will cost you points, and each time you do it, it will cost more and more, so don't overdo it.

  • You can also downgrade a tile to an easier level, or use a super downgrade to downgrade an entire 3x3 block!

  • You can clear the entire board and start from scratch. This will cost all your points. Does that make sense? You decide.

The game's graphics are inspired by MS-DOS games from the 1990s, and the sounds are, appropriately enough, rendered through FM synthesis. All the old tricks still work!
